What's new?

These are still early days for Prompter and it's adding features rapidly, so check in here each time you check it out from github.

Version 1.14 (Sat 26 Oct)

- A significant change: people now begin in limbo, and are not by default put
into the first-defined location at the start of play. They must now be put into
place explicitly.
- "Anyone else" is now allowed as a speaker, meaning, the speaker can be anybody
other than the person who spoke the last line. Thus:

	Anyone: I like green eggs and ham!

	Anyone else: I don't!

- A line which is "replying" is taken to be "to X", where X is the person who
spoke the previous line. Thus:

	Daphne: I like green eggs and ham!

	Fred (replying): I don't!

is equivalent to

	Fred (to Daphne): I don't!

but

	Anyone: I like green eggs and ham!

	Anyone else (replying): I don't!

is something which couldn't previously be done, since the name of the previous
speaker isn't known to the author.

Version 1.13 (Thurs 24 Oct)

- Added support for the styling escapes and for non-ASCII text, such as accented
letters, in dialogue; to match changes Richard made to Praxis earlier today.

Version 1.11 (Tue 22 Oct)

- The condition "if X is present" checks whether a person X is in the same place
as whoever is being discussed - which usually means, the speaker of a line of
dialogue. For example:

	(if Linus is present) Storm: Hey, Linus, are you sure red is neutral?
	-- Ask Linus if he really knows about defusing bombs

Version 1.10 (Sun 20 Oct)

- At the start of a scene one can now say that characters feel emotions:

	(Jake is happy.)

(You can't say "becomes", because this isn't a moment when change takes place, and
similarly you can't say "visibly", because there's no change to be observed.)
- The opening lines of the playtext (only) can say that it's a sequel:

	The sequel to "rome1".

This means it won't be playable until the story whose moniker is "rome1" has been
completed. There can be several of these:

	"Return of the Jedi" by George Lucas

	The sequel to "starwars", "empire".

- Prompter now supports persistent storage between stories. This is very simply
done: there are named tokens which can be either created, or not. We can create
them at all of the usual places - in the Scenario, when a scene begins, in
dialogue, on an event, on an activity. Here's how:

	*** Event - Ground Zero Explosion ***

	(Create the token "Bomb Detonated".)

In future plays of this story, or in plays of other stories in the same app, the
token "Bomb Detonated" now appears as created.
- The existence of a token can be checked in any condition, so for example:

	(if the token "Bomb Detonated" has been created) Jack: Nothing's ever been
	the same since that so-called test in the desert.

- Characters in a cast list can now be made available only if a token is created.
For example:

	Atom Spy ... Boris Sneakovitch (unlocked by the token "Bomb Detonated")

- "RequiredCharacters" field added to story.info, which isn't needed by the simulator,
but is needed for a shipping app.

Version 1.01 (Sun 13 Oct)

- A few more tailored problem messages added, at Jake's suggestion; various
bugs to do with problem-reporting attended to; after-effects such as "X becomes
happy" now work after narration.

Version 1.0 (Tue 1 Oct)

- Documentation now available as plain text, Epub-format ebook, and HTML
- Added the ability to create new characters not written in Praxis
- Added the flow test visualiser

Version 0.32 (Mon 30 Sep)

- Characters are now enabled to walk about between adjacent rooms; though by
default they won't do so. The ability has to be switched on for any scene where
you want this to be possible:

	(Characters may walk around.)

- Scenes can now specify that the only dialogue allowed is the dialogue specifically
written for this scene - not any Throughout dialogue, nor any random remarks from
the character files:

	(Conversation is restricted.)

- Bugs fixed to do with initial position of props; multiple scene transitions
between the same pair of scenes; "continuing..." quips being marked introductory.

Version 0.31 (Sun 29 Sep)

- Appreciably faster on very large playtexts.

Version 0.30 (Tue 24 Sep)

- Events have been added: see the manual for details. These are major plot elements,
like scenes and activities, but they represent things that happen without direct
player intervention. A thunderstorm, or a phone ringing, might be an Event.
- A "Choice:" offered in a Scene or Event can now have a condition attached which
determines whether it's available or not, like so:

	(if Storm is alone) Choice: Storm flirts with the postman, who eventually
	goes away quite flustered, having forgotten to hand over the letter.
	-- Flirt outrageously with this total stranger

Version 0.29 (Mon 23 Sep)

- Events have been added: see the manual for details. These are major plot elements,
like scenes and activities, but they represent things that happen without direct
player intervention. A thunderstorm, or a phone ringing, might be an Event.
- Prompter is a bit less prone to thinking that "the bridge", "The bridge" and
"bridge" might in some circumstances be different; this especially affects topics,
in practice.
- Props can now be carried by: for example,

	The briefcase is a prop carried by Linus.
	The paperweight is a portable prop in the Office.

- New emotion: "surprised". New manner of speaking: "loyally" and "disloyally".
- Corrected mistake in manual, which said "X thinks that Y's Q is R" was the way
to set or test Y's quality Q to range R in X's estimation; it should actually be
"X rates Y's Q as R", as in, "Fred rates Daphne's attractiveness as excellent".

Version 0.28 (Sun 22 Sep)

- Activities have become more powerful. They can be made conditional with a
variety of options in brackets:

	*** Activity - Read the memo ("Take a look at the memo", for Storm only,
	during Office Meeting only, if Linus is happy) ***

Also, they can display pictures, make emotional changes, make belief changes, award
achievements, set objectives, have people change their ratings of each other, and
so on, exactly as scenes can, and with the same syntax. They can also end:

	(Going on to T.)

for any topic T, which tells Prompter that after the activity has happened, people
are likely to want to talk about T.
- Speeches can also now display pictures:

	Storm: Oh my! (Display "spilt_tea.png".)
	-- Pour the tea

- The condition "X is alone", where X is a person, does the obvious thing.

Version 0.27 (Fri 20 Sep)

- Achievements are now available. At a scene start:

	(This is the achievement "Had high tea". "At last, high tea has been served.")

And in a speech:

	Storm: Let me pour the Earl Grey. (This is the achievement "Had high tea".
	"At last, high tea has been served.")

Each achievement can appear in only one place. Those called "ending achievement"
go on to be recorded at the end of the game.
- There's a new condition for who the player is playing:

	(if Storm is being played) Linus: You're so unpredictable today.
	(if he is being played) Anyone: Look, it's my decision.
- Optimised to load quips only as needed at scene starts, to speed up play in
large complicated stories.

Version 0.26 (Thu 19 Sep)

- There's a cheat sheet for how to convert Praxis code to Prompter, for those who
know it already; this is called ConvertingFromPraxis.txt and is in the prompter folder,
alongside the Manual.txt.
- In narration, escaped names like [jordan_fischer] no longer need to be given with
Praxis identifiers - this was an oversight. [Jordan] is now fine.
- By popular request, the Simulator link now goes straight into the Simulator, not
via a landing page; and it opens it in a new tab in Chrome, so you can refer back
to the Scenes diagram if you need to.
- There's a way to start a conversation which doesn't begin unless a topic is
already being talked about - in Praxis terms, it begins with a quip which is not
introductory, i.e., doesn't have the ability to change the subject. This is to use
the stage direction "(Continuing on unicorns.)", or whatever.
- There's now a way to add a picture to a scene ("tableau" in Praxis):

	(Display "characters/jenkins/img/jenkins_goes_fishing.png".)

- The Scenes index now shows picture usage, narration, and the topic which a scene
is "about" (if any) on the dialogue panel, and gives a subtle highlight to scenes
which contain art in the Scenes diagram.
- You can now use a "++" stage direction to insert raw Praxis into a scene definition:

	(++ whatever.you.like!true)

- Pronouns can now be used in conditions attached to speeches if we need to refer
to the speaker but don't know who that is:

	(if he is angry) Anybody except Raina: Oh do be quiet, young lady.

- The Include sentence (as in "Include Modern Furniture.") up at the top of the
playtext is now documented, and has the ability to use locations outside "core/",
e.g., local to the project.
- You can specify that a character file comes from the project's own folder rather
than the core Versu set, in the cast list, by marking it "(unique to this story)":

	Enemy ... Darth Vader (unique to this story)

- There's now a way to set objectives for the player. At a scene start:

	(The objective "Meet Alice" for Storm will be achieved when Storm is a friend
	of Alice.)

And in a speech:

	Storm: Who's that? (The objective "Greet Alice" for Storm will be achieved when
	Storm is a friend of Alice.)

If you don't say whom an objective is for, it'll apply to the player whatever character
the player currently is.
